image.altText: A group of students in maroon uniforms sit in a circle on grass

props.synopsis: Kanyanyapilla means "place of many eagles", and it's where Indigenous students in Adelaide are coming to connect with Kaurna culture.

title.children: 'Sentimental and special': Students find connection through Kaurna program

image.altText: Auburn and yellowish green orchid in the shape of a duck head with wings stretched out behind it

props.synopsis: Two centuries after orchids were first documented in South Australia, photographers are still discovering new plants.

title.children: Native orchids captivate photographers in search of undiscovered bush treasure

image.altText: A black and white photo of a house with fallen bricks in front.

props.synopsis: Adelaide sits on the most active seismic zone in Australia and has more than its fair share of tremors below magnitude-4, but it's been 71 years since it was rocked by a serious earthquake. Now, it's a matter of if, not when, it gets another one.

title.children: Is Adelaide due for another big earthquake?

image.altText: A woman dressed in a protective helmet lays under stalactites in a cave

props.synopsis: It was an adventure into the unknown. From the surface all that could be seen was a small opening. The ABC has been given exclusive access to newly-discovered caves on South Australia's Kangaroo Island.

title.children: Phoenix cave 'rises from the ashes' amid discovery after KI bushfires

image.altText: A collage of photos of Alice Wilkinson with friends and family, centered on a large black and white photo of Alice.

props.synopsis: Alice Wilkinson loved music and was the life of the party. Her death has prompted her family to help others who might be struggling.

title.children: Alice took her own life at 13. Now her family is fundraising to help others

image.altText: A group of people walk in front of a hearse

props.synopsis: Key players including Anthony Albanese, Peter Dutton, Peter Malinauskas and Julie Inman-Grant tell the inside story of how an unprecedented ban came to be.

title.children: Grieving parents and horrified politicians brought social ban to life

image.altText: A man in a plaid yellow shirt, glasses and face mask walks out of court being questioned by reporters.

props.synopsis: An unqualified massage therapist who sexually abused more than 60 women left his victims with "trauma" and "severe psychological harm", a court has heard. Warning: This story contains descriptions of sexual abuse.

title.children: Victims tell court of trauma inflicted by Adelaide massage therapist

image.altText: A hand dropping very fine, dry soil.

props.synopsis: The federal government is introducing new low-interest loans for drought-affected farmers and algae-impacted fishers, but some are worried it doesn't go far enough.

title.children: Farmers and fishers offered lifeline as government expands loans

image.altText: Hands holding a purple-cover report held close to the body

props.synopsis: The South Australian government has committed more than $600 million over a decade to reduce the prevalence of — and protect the victims of — domestic, family and sexual violence, in response to a landmark royal commission earlier this year.

title.children: SA domestic violence royal commission prompts $674 million response

image.altText: Ashton Hurn talks to the media while flanked by five other ministers

props.synopsis: South Australia's new Liberal leader Ashton Hurn unveils a "streamlined" shadow cabinet, just 99 days out from the next state election.

title.children: New SA Liberal leader unveils shadow cabinet

image.altText: A man standing over a map and soil samples.

props.synopsis: The processing market is dominated by China, but Australia is building its capabilities in an attempt to boost the domestic industry.

title.children: First Australian rare earth processing facility under construction

image.altText: Ashton Hurn looks to the right of screen in front of six microphones

props.synopsis: Only days after taking her party's top job, Liberal leader Ashton Hurn is under pressure on a key election promise.

title.children: Labor tries to end Ashton Hurn's 'honeymoon' early

image.altText: A police officer in uniform surrounded by cameras in front of dark glass doors

props.synopsis: South Australia's top cop has taken on an extra role, joining the Adelaide Football Club's board of directors.

title.children: Adelaide Crows appoint Police Commissioner Grant Stevens to club's board

image.altText: A composite of four young men in black and white.

props.synopsis: After more than eight decades, James Burrowes had just about given up hope of ever knowing what truly happened to his uncle Tom, an Air Force crew member who disappeared in World War II.

title.children: Missing RAAF crew found in WWII plane wreckage in PNG rainforest

image.altText: Blurry vision of an oil tanker with 'Unclassified' written in green letters at the top.

props.synopsis: Tensions between the US and Venezuela are soaring after American forces seized an oil tanker in the Caribbean Sea. So why is US President Donald Trump targeting so-called "shadow fleets"?

title.children: This ship spent months in 'shadow', then US forces swooped in

image.altText: A young Indigenous man crouching on sandy beach, holding green fishing line ring holder, black t-shirt, camo shorts.

props.synopsis: This remote East Arnhem land community is home to 50 permanent residents. There's no shop and only one road in or out. And its unconventional approach to teaching is keeping kids in the classroom.

title.children: 'The forgotten island' where kids are taught in a condemned classroom

image.altText: Standing in the Roman ruins in Baalbek.

props.synopsis: Two US service members and one American civilian are killed in an ambush in central Syria.

title.children: US troops killed in Syria ambush

image.altText: A man walks through a snow storm

props.synopsis: It has been a busy year for search and rescue operations in the Tasmanian high country. Authorities say a concerning number of visitors to the state's famous national parks are ill-prepared for the fickle weather — even during summer.

title.children: Visiting Cradle Mountain this summer? Let these images be a warning

image.altText: Photo of hands clasped on chair arms

props.synopsis: A Child Death Review Board investigation into the systemic failings that enabled the abuse has laid bare issues in the childcare system.

title.children: What childcare centres could have done to stop Ashley Paul Griffith

image.altText: Street sign of Aerodrome Rd and Fourth Ave.

props.synopsis: Police say a vehicle struck a group of pedestrians on Saturday night.

title.children: Woman in critical condition after reports car hit eight people on Sunshine Coast

image.altText: Actor Sydney Sweeney wearing a silver dress.

props.synopsis: Sydney Sweeney changed a lot about herself to play Christy Martin in a biopic about the boxer. She says it was a role she had to take.

title.children: 'Most incredible woman': Sydney Sweeney opens up on boxer Christy Martin

image.altText: Peter Greene in a security uniform pointing.

props.synopsis: Peter Greene, a character actor best known for his role as the iconic villain, Zed in Pulp Fiction, has died.

title.children: Pulp Fiction, The Mask actor Peter Greene dies aged 60

image.altText: A man throwing his shoes.

props.synopsis: It has been 17 years since Iraqi journalist Muntadhar al-Zaidi hurled his shoes at then-United States president George W Bush at a press conference in Baghdad.

title.children: The day a journalist threw his shoes at a US president

image.altText: A crowd at a Lionel Messi appearance.

props.synopsis: Indian football fans ripped up seats and invaded the pitch in Kolkata as Lionel Messi's first appearance in India took a chaotic and dangerous turn.

title.children: Chaos as Indian fans riot at Lionel Messi appearance

image.altText: Show image for Hard Quiz: Tom Gleeson in a navy blue suit in a studio.

props.synopsis: Your track record doesn't leave me hopeful.

title.children: Hard Quiz: It's the season of giving so I'm gifting you a chance at redemption

image.altText: A woman holds a netball and smiles while standing in a gym.

props.synopsis: Zara Walters felt tired, dizzy and unable to recover from training sessions — then she found out she was low in iron. It's a condition that often goes undiagnosed, especially in female athletes.

title.children: 'It makes training sessions feel twice as hard': Zara Walters was running on empty

image.altText: young ethan in hospital bed

props.synopsis: Ethan Monck's health problems began the day he was born. Now aged 17, he's celebrating after starting his first job and the freedom it gives him to pursue his hobbies.

title.children: Victorian teenager celebrates dream job after battling childhood cancer

image.altText: Two men wearing face coverings and green headbands, holding rifles, escort a jeep through rubble.

props.synopsis: It was the highest-profile assassination of a senior Hamas figure since a Gaza ceasefire deal came into effect in October.

title.children: Israel says it killed senior Hamas commander Raed Saed in Gaza

image.altText: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, Virginia Giuffre and Ghislaine Maxwell posing for a picture.

props.synopsis: London's police force says it will not take further action over claims that former prince Andrew asked his protection officer to carry out checks on Virginia Roberts Giuffre.

title.children: Police won't probe claim former prince asked bodyguard to investigate Giuffre

image.altText: Avwoman sits on a bed in shadows, her face is obscured.

props.synopsis: In a region with Western Australia's highest rates of family and domestic violence, a Kimberley service provider says it can only help one-third of women who need it.

title.children: Hundreds turned away from refuge shelter due to lack of beds

image.altText: An aerial view of the Parramatta skyline

props.synopsis: Warnings have been raised for NSW not to be "complacent" about the state's ability to fight high-rise apartment fires, following last month's blaze in the Wang Fuk Court estate complex in Hong Kong.

title.children: Is Sydney's high-rise future equipped to withstand a Hong Kong-like fire?

image.altText: Two teenage girls sitting in a room, with musical equipment behind them.

props.synopsis: With sounds recorded in a makeshift studio, this group of high school students produced music about First Nations culture.

title.children: The budding musicians 'staying proud' through Indigenous rap music

image.altText: An older, skinny white man with a moustache is surrounded by white cell bars.

props.synopsis: Belarusian authorities release 123 prisoners including Nobel Peace Prize laureate Ales Bialiatski and key opposition figure Maria Kolesnikova, after talks with an envoy for US President Donald Trump.

title.children: Belarus releases Nobel winner Bialiatski as US lifts more sanctions

image.altText: A cargo ship passing in the distance at Moffat Beach at Caloundra

props.synopsis: Emergency services were called about 6:40pm following reports a teenager had fallen from a cliff.

title.children: Teenage girl dies after falling from cliff at Moffat Beach
